Title: Pharmacy practice in the UK
Source: Encyclopedia of Pharm. Practice and Clinical Pharm.
Abstract: © 2019 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.This chapter provides a broad overview of the development of pharmacy as a profession and the evolving role of the pharmacist in the United Kingdom. To start, the chapter outlines the history of pharmacy, and how it has shaped modern day practice, as well as the challenges the UK faces today and in future. The wider aspects of pharmacy practice such as the healthcare context in which it operates and the relevant organizations such as the regulatory bodies and professional leadership groups are also introduced. This chapter serves to explore the core elements of pharmacy practice in primary, secondary, and tertiary settings, including service delivery, integrated models of care, and the use of technology in pharmacies across the UK.
